intro: Neocuatrecasia mancoana, commonly known as the Mancó Tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary growth forests. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
